poem:
**New Dawn**

Kemi,  
a name cast,  
in the grainy light—  
of morning newsprint,  
breaking the age-old  
stain, like sunlight  
over arching steeples.  

Her voice, a rising breeze  
through aisles of  
stubborn oaks,  
each syllable carved—  
a bright scrawl  
against the stone  
of tradition.

Change murmurs  
softly in the margins.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Kemi Badenoch wins Tory leadership election Kemi Badenoch is the new Conservative party leader after defeating Robert Jenrick in a members’ vote, becoming the first Black leader of a major UK party and the fourth woman to lead the Tories. Badenoch took just over 56% of the 95,000 votes, in a poll that had a 73% turnout of eligible members. This amounts to the narrowest win of the four since the party changed its rules". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Kemi Badenoch wins Tory leadership election Kemi Badenoch is the new Conservative party leader after defeating Robert Jenrick in a members’ vote, becoming the first Black leader of a major UK party and the fourth woman to lead the Tories. Badenoch took just over 56% of the 95,000 votes, in a poll that had a 73% turnout of eligible members. This amounts to the narrowest win of the four since the party changed its rules
